replies.msg: 第2點諗起毒毒

飯仔傷4-6wk
我好似第一次見佢傷

Midfielder Rice suffered a knee injury while on international duty in the last of England’s three World Cup qualifiers, against Poland, and will miss Monday night’s game against Wolverhampton Wanderers.

It is understood Rice has been wearing a protective brace to make sure he does no more damage, while he and West Ham wait for the swelling to go down and for the results of scans.

The initial fear is that Rice could miss four to six weeks, which would mean he could still play a part in West Ham’s run-in and be part of Southgate’s England squad for the European Championships.

But the worst case scenario would possibly see Rice to miss the rest of the campaign or even have to undergo surgery, which would almost certainly mean rule him out of the Euros.
